body: This was something I thought would be cool for reddit but it also applies here. Instead of having one set of mods for everybody on each guild, why not have no global mods at all, and instead each user can pick who they want to mod Ruqqus for them. When those mods remove something, it gets removed only for the users who picked them. Users could also perform these actions themselves. This should include admin actions such as banning users and subreddits. Maybe Ruqqus should even become completely decentralized like notabug is. This would include not using Discord anymore because these ideas are not possible there. This would remove all of reddit's flaws regarding mods, thus permanently solving the powermod problem. The only things that would need actual deletion then is the admins removing illegal content.

body: It's a little bit more complicated than that. Guildmasters can ban users, and kicking to +general is kind of like a removal. And the admins actually have banned a few users that technically didn't even violate the content policy, and when asked about why they did that they were very rude and untransparent. Usually they're nice people, but for some reason anything having to do with this, as well as mods (Discord and admin guilds), is something they refuse to talk about.
